hours_text:
## More Information

Address & Hours 

[__Address 118 Cotten Rd., Patterson, 70392  
  
985-399-1268 ]()

[__Hours **ATTENTION: Louisiana State Museums will be closed on Tuesday, July 4. Happy Independence Day!** Tuesdays–Saturdays, 9:30 a.m.–4 p.m.  
  
​Closed on state holidays.  ]()

Admissions 

[__Admissions [Get Tickets](http://web.archive.org/web/20230622180853/https://ticketing.louisianastatemuseum.org/webstore/shop/viewitems.aspx?cg=patterson&c=wwtkts) Free ]()

* * *

[__   
_Individuals with special needs are requested to contact Museum staff members to make other arrangements._ ]()

Education 

[__Education Programs Wedell-Williams Cypress Sawmill & Aviation Museum currently has these education programs:

  * Field Trips

]()

## Virtual Tour

[](http://web.archive.org/web/20230622180853/https://goo.gl/jZyJJU)

[Interior](http://web.archive.org/web/20230622180853/https://goo.gl/jZyJJU)

**ATTENTION: Louisiana State Museums will be closed on Tuesday, July 4. Happy Independence Day!**

The dual focus of this museum site highlights two very distinct—and compelling—aspects of Louisiana’s rich history.

The Wedell-Williams Aviation Collection highlights the legacy of Louisiana aviation pioneers Jimmie Wedell and Harry P. Williams, who formed an air service together in 1928 in Patterson. Both men became nationally prominent during the Golden Age of Aviation. Although both Wedell and Williams perished in plane crashes, their legacy lives on in the memorabilia and planes ...
